intro: Eriostemon glaber, commonly known as the smooth eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
